descriptions: Moth answers yes to the Glory, Velvet answers no.

links.label: opposed_to
descriptions: Lionsmith creates monsters to defeat the Colonel, but the Colonel's scars are weapons.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The Wood grows outside the walls of the Mansus, yet the Mansus has no walls.

links.label: visited
descriptions: He repeatedly visited the Wood in his silver dreams.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Illopoly believed Elagabalus was a puppet or incarnation of the Sun-in-Rags.
Elagabalus was a puppet or incarnation of the Sun-in-Rags.

links.label: visited
descriptions: Elagabalus finally found the White Door.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The White is west of the world; the White Door is associated with the White.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Baldomei wanted the Stag Door.

links.label: killed, allied_with, associated_with
descriptions: Even the Sun-in-Splendour can be divided, though it required the Forge of Days to act.
Forge loved the Sun.
Forge shares desire with the Sun.
Forge split the Sun, killing him.
The Forge of Days split the Sun-in-Splendour.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: She studied dreams of craftsmen about the Wood.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: She recorded that the most skilled craftsmen dreamed of the White Door.

links.label: guards, associated_with
descriptions: Mother of Ants guards both up and down on the stairs of the Mansus.
Guards both sides of the Stairs of the Mansus.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The White Door might be the wound; to pass, must go through the wound, and she guards both sides.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Janus is seen as the Watchman.
Janus is identified with the Watchman.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Janus is seen as the Twins (Witch-and-Sister).
Janus is identified with the Twins.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Janus is seen as the Mother of Ants.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Janus is seen as the Forge.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Janus is seen as the Meniscate.
Janus is identified with the Meniscate.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Janus is seen as the Madrugad.
Janus is identified with the Madrugad.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Hush insisted that the Hours are Janus.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Coseley preferred that the Hours are not Janus.

links.label: opposed_to
descriptions: Hush and Coseley disagreed on whether the Hours are Janus.
Hush warns against Coseley, describing him as 'worm of worms'.
Hush warns of Coseley's evil, indicating opposition.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The book is about Winter and its romance with the Sun; The White is associated with Winter.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Solomon Herschel wrote about The White.

links.label: killed
descriptions: Apollo flayed Marsyas after losing the music contest.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Marsyas's skin was made into a drum.

links.label: uses
descriptions: Priestesses of Cybele made the drum and used it.

links.label: serves, served_by
descriptions: The priestesses serve Cybele.
Priestesses serve Cybele.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Sir Percival seeks the Red Grail.
Sought the Red Grail.

links.label: located_in
descriptions: The Peacock Door is a door in the Mansus.
The Peacock Door is in the Mansus.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The book hints at a connection between Witch-and-Sister and the Velvet.
Suggests a connection with the Velvet.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The Pine Knight seeks the Cinnabar Cup.

links.label: created
descriptions: After the knight castrated and flayed himself, Wakeful Storm emerged from his remains.

links.label: allied_with
descriptions: The Mother of Mountains and Wakeful Storm have a dialogue and share a law.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: The law of the Sun is mentioned.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Wakeful Storm adheres to the Sun's law.

links.label: opposed_to
descriptions: A scarred man (likely the Colonel) drags Chione out of the city.
The Colonel opposes Chione, dragging her out.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Chione is a snow goddess associated with winter.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Successful members passed through the Stag Door.

links.label: associated_with
descriptions: Inspired by Controlled Fire (the Forge).
